Dear Hagop,

Hope this email finds you well.

 

We are in the process of evaluating a vendor SIS ID for Payee Verification during vendor onboarding/modification. As part of vendor bank information verification service, they are also offering an insurance. Details are below. Would you be able to advise us what this would cost if we were to get this kind of coverage independently:

This might help in our cost negotiations with this vendor.

 



 

Regards,

Arjun.

ARJUN BHARADWAJ​​​​

To: Arjun Bharadwaj
CC: James Adams <James.Adams@chalhoub.com>; Binay Kumar <Binay.Santuka@chalhoub.com>; Priya Advani <Priya.Advani@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2024-11-05 22:07
Subject: Re: SIS ID - Payee Verification
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Arjun,
We already have coverage in place, though it requires us to cover an initial USD 15,000 before the insurance becomes effective.
Additional coverage could provide an extra layer of security. If we were to purchase insurance that covers the full limit of loss with no deductible, the estimated cost would be between USD 5,000 and 10,000 for a USD 500,000 limit policy.
It’s worth noting that this system is designed primarily as a preventative measure to reduce or ideally prevent fraudulent transfers. This additional insurance would act as a safety net, providing peace of mind by covering us in case of system failure.
To gain perspective, I recommend comparing the liability limits of other vendors for situations where fraudulent transfers occur due to failures in account verification. Understanding the extent of responsibility other vendors assume if their systems fail to detect fraud would be a reasonable comparison metric.
Best Regards,
HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​	
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION	
M.C.T.

Best Regards,
HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​	
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION	
M.C.T. FZE	
DUBAI
